Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, who brings forth bread from the earth.

question: What was the verse spoken by the narrator at the end of the episode "Jesus Feeds the Hungry"?
answer: It was 2 Corinthians 9:10 from the New King James Version: “Now may He who supplies seed to the sower, and bread for food, supply and multiply the seed you have sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness.”

question: Why didn't Mary and Joseph know sooner that Jesus was not with them?
answer: Joseph and Mary were probably part of a group that had travelled together from Nazareth to Jerusalem and was then returning to Nazareth after celebrating the Passover. Travelling together gave them added protection and the ability to share resources. Since they were all one tight-knit group, Joseph and Mary thought that Jesus was with the other children.

question: Why did Joseph say that since Jesus was 12 years old He was “almost a man”?
answer: In Jewish culture, it is thought that a 13-year-old boy enters the beginning of adulthood and is responsible for his actions.

question: Is Satan really the god of this age?
answer: Although Satan is not God nor the Creator of this world, the apostle Paul wrote that Satan is the god of this world: “Satan, who is the god of this world, has blinded the minds of those who don't believe” (2 Corinthians 4:4 NLT). At least two other Bible versions (NIV, LEB) use the phrase “god of this age” in this verse. In addition, Jesus called Satan the ruler of this world (John 14:30). While Satan still has a hold over the world (1 John 5:19), we should remember that Jesus defeated him (Hebrews 2:14). In addition, Jesus has given us authority over the enemy (Matthew 16:17, Luke 10:19). As God's children, He gives us victory over the evil in this world (1 John 4:4, 5:4).

question: In the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness" why did you show a promotion of a violent and hideous holographic game? “Blades of Bedlam III” was described as being for kids 17 and over.
answer: In today's culture, kids may be exposed to advertisements for violent video games. We wanted to show that they shouldn't give in to temptation and peer pressure.

question: In the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness" why did Joseph and Mary not recognize Chris and Joy from “The First Christmas”?
answer: Joseph and Mary's minds were preoccupied with thoughts of finding Jesus. In addition, they would have expected Chris and Joy to be 12 years older since the time when Jesus was born.

question: In the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness" why did the pomegranate spoil immediately after Lucifer held it?
answer: We used creative license to show that Satan brings death and destruction. Jesus once stated, “The thief's purpose is to steal and kill and destroy. My purpose is to give them a rich and satisfying life” (John 10:10 NLT).

question: In the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness" what did Jesus mean when He said that He had to be about His “Father's” business?
answer: In the episode, Jesus said to Mary and Joseph, “Why did you seek Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father's business?” (Luke 2:49 NKJV) He was referring to God as His Heavenly Father and that He would be in the Father's house, that is, the Temple. In another Bible version, Jesus tells his parents, “But why did you need to search? Didn't you know that I must be in my Father's house?” (NLT)

question: Will an angel catch me if I fall off a cliff like the angel saved Chris?
answer: God has guardian angels that help protect us, but we should not presume that an angel will save us from a fall. We should not be careless or reckless. Instead, we should exercise appropriate caution and wisdom. As Jesus said, “You must not test the LORD your God” (Luke 4:12 NLT).

question: In the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness" why did you show Satan walking on air?
answer: We used creative license to show how cunning and tricky Satan can be in tempting us to sin. In this case, he was tempting Jesus to jump off the Temple. The apostle Paul wrote about Satan, “For we are familiar with his evil schemes” (2 Corinthians 2:11 NLT).

question: What are the different kingdoms that were shown by Satan to Jesus in the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness"?
answer: Although the Bible does not name the specific kingdoms that were shown, we depicted stylized images of Rome, the Great Wall of China, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Pyramids of Giza, and the Lighthouse of Alexandria.

question: What were the angels doing when they laid hands on Jesus in the episode "Jesus in the Wilderness"?
answer: We used creative license to show how they may have strengthened Him after His 40-day fast and being tempted by Satan. The Bible tells us, “Then the devil went away, and angels came and took care of Jesus” (Matthew 4:11 NLT).

question: What was the large building in the first scene of the episode "Paul and Barnabas"?
answer: It was the Temple in Jerusalem.

question: In the episode "Paul and Barnabas" who were the two men in the Temple who were discussing what to do about the disciples?
answer: We used creative license to show two members of the Jewish high council discussing what to do about the disciples. A Pharisee named Gamaliel is the one who urged caution, but the high priest disagreed.

question: In the episode "Paul and Barnabas" what was the flaming golden circle that appeared before the angel entered the prison cell?
answer: We used artistic license to show a portal from the spiritual realm to the natural realm.

question: In the episode "Paul and Barnabas" what was the golden glow around Paul before he rebuked the sorcerer?
answer: We used artistic license to show Paul being filled with the Holy Spirit and receiving a prophetic message from God. The Bible tells us, Saul, also known as Paul, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and he looked the sorcerer in the eye. Then he said… (Acts 13:9-10 NLT).

question: In the episode "Paul and Barnabas" what was the gray color coming into the background when Paul was prophesying about the sorcerer?
answer: We used artistic license to show, from the sorcerer's perspective, how his eyesight began to disappear. The Bible tells us, Instantly mist and darkness came over the man's eyes, and he began groping around begging for someone to take his hand and lead him (Acts 13:11 NLT).

question: Why did Paul and Barnabas tear their clothes when the people wanted to sacrifice at the pagan temples to honor Paul and Barnabas?
answer: In their culture, tearing your clothes was an expression of great emotional distress. In this case, they were very upset that the people thought that they were gods and were planning to sacrifice to honor them.

question: Which Scripture verses were Paul and Barnabas speaking when Paul got up after the stoning?
answer: They were speaking from Psalm 138: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch out Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, and Your right hand will save me (v. 7 NKJV). The LORD will work out his plans for my life… (v. 8 NLT).

question: What happened when Superbook took Chris, Joy and Gizmo and they were suspended in the air?
answer: Superbook was taking them from one point in time to a future event in the Bible story. Superbook wanted them to understand the situation He was taking them to, so He showed them important events that occurred in between the two points in time.

question: In the episode "Philip" what were the pictures on the wall in the sorcerer's home?
answer: They were depictions of pagan zodiac images.

question: What was the golden glow that went through the crippled man when Philip prayed for him?
answer: We used artistic license to show the power of God healing him. The Bible tells us, “Crowds listened intently to Philip because they were eager to hear his message and see the miraculous signs he did. … And many who had been paralyzed or lame were healed. So there was great joy in that city” (Acts 8:6-8, NLT).

question: When Peter and John were traveling to Samaria, why didn't they recognize Chris and Joy from earlier events like those in “Peter's Denial”?
answer: We wanted to keep the focus of the episode on the current biblical events. Also, in order to keep Superbook episodes more historically accurate, the biblical characters do not retain long-term memories of Chris, Joy and Gizmo from one episode to the next.

question: What was the glow that came upon the believers when Peter and John prayed for them to receive the Holy Spirit?
answer: We used artistic license to show them receiving the Holy Spirit. The Bible records, “Then Peter and John laid their hands upon these believers, and they received the Holy Spirit” (Acts 8:17 NLT).

question: Did you depict the Samaritan believers speaking in tongues?
answer: Yes. The book of Acts shows that there was some kind of visible manifestation of having received the Holy Spirit. It says, “When Simon saw that the Spirit was given when the apostles laid their hands on people, he offered them money to buy this power” (Acts 8:18 NLT). In addition, the Bible shows us that on the Day of Pentecost, when the believers were filled with the Holy Spirit, they spoke in unlearned languages: “And everyone present was filled with the Holy Spirit and began speaking in other languages, as the Holy Spirit gave them this ability” (Acts 2:4 NLT).

question: When the Ethiopian entourage approached, what was the voice Philip heard?
answer: It was the Holy Spirit speaking to Philip. The Bible says, “The Holy Spirit said to Philip, 'Go over and walk along beside the carriage'” (Acts 8:29 NLT).

question: What was the Bible passage the Ethiopian was reading?
answer: It was the Greek version of Isaiah 53:7-8: “'He was led like a sheep to the slaughter. And as a lamb is silent before the shearers, he did not open his mouth. He was humiliated and received no justice. Who can speak of his descendants? For his life was taken from the earth'” (Acts 8:32-33 NLT).

question: How do you know what Philip shared with the Ethiopian?
answer: We used creative license to depict what Philip told him. The Bible tells us, “The eunuch asked Philip, 'Tell me, was the prophet talking about himself or someone else?' So beginning with this same Scripture, Philip told him the Good News about Jesus” (Acts 8:34-35 NLT).

question: What was the glow on the Ethiopian when he was baptized?
answer: We used artistic license to show the Holy Spirit coming upon the Ethiopian.

question: What was the golden swirl of light that took Philip into the air?
answer: We used artistic license to show the Holy Spirit taking Philip to another place. The Bible records what happened, “When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away. The eunuch never saw him again but went on his way rejoicing. Meanwhile, Philip found himself farther north at the town of Azotus. He preached the Good News there and in every town along the way until he came to Caesarea” (Acts 8:39-40 NLT).

question: In the episode "Philip" what happened when Superbook took Chris, Joy and Gizmo and suspended them in the air again?
answer: Superbook wanted to show them what happened when Philip was taken up and what he did after that.

question: Why did they have a statue of a bird in the episode "The Birth of Moses"?
answer: It was a statue of Horus, an Egyptian false god.

question: Why did the Egyptians enslave the Hebrews?
answer: When Joseph was serving as second-in-command of Egypt, the Hebrews enjoyed a time of favor. However, a new pharaoh arose that did not know how Joseph had interpreted Pharaoh's dream and served well as the second-in-command of Egypt. This new pharaoh saw that the Hebrews were growing in number and strength, and the Egyptians were afraid that the Hebrews might fight against them. The Bible tells us:  “Eventually, a new king came to power in Egypt who knew nothing about Joseph or what he had done. He said to his people, 'Look, the people of Israel now outnumber us and are stronger than we are. We must make a plan to keep them from growing even more. If we don't, and if war breaks out, they will join our enemies and fight against us. Then they will escape from the country.' So the Egyptians made the Israelites their slaves. They appointed brutal slave drivers over them, hoping to wear them down with crushing labor. They forced them to build the cities of Pithom and Rameses as supply centers for the king. But the more the Egyptians oppressed them, the more the Israelites multiplied and spread, and the more alarmed the Egyptians became. So the Egyptians worked the people of Israel without mercy. They made their lives bitter, forcing them to mix mortar and make bricks and do all the work in the fields. They were ruthless in all their demands.” (Exodus 1:8-14 NLT).

question: Why did you show an Egyptian using a whip?
answer: We wanted to be historically accurate about the cruel conditions of slavery, but we were careful to not show someone being whipped. However, we did include the sound of a whip and a Hebrew slave crying out so as to illustrate the situation.

question: What were the bricks being used for in the episode "The Birth of Moses"?
answer: They were used to build cities in Egypt. The Bible tells us, “They forced them to build the cities of Pithom and Rameses as supply centers for the king” (Exodus 1:11 NLT).

question: What was it that kept Chris, Joy and Gizmo from moving more than a few feet in the biblical events?
answer: Superbook created a transparent dome that allowed them to see the events but not to interact with the Biblical characters.

question: Why couldn't the Biblical characters see Chris and Joy watching them?
answer: The dome they were in kept the Biblical characters from being able to see or hear them.

question: When Joy was looking at the Garden of Eden and said, “There. Look. It's God!”, was she seeing God the Father or Jesus the Son?
answer: We depicted God the Father walking majestically through the garden. The Bible reveals that the Creator really did walk in the midst of His creation: “And they heard the sound of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God among the trees of the garden” (Genesis 3:8 NKJV).

question: When Chris, Joy and Gizmo were suspended in the air and watching events through the windows, where were they?
answer: Superbook took them to a supernatural realm so they could quickly see a few key biblical events without having to travel back in time.

question: What does “reconciled” mean?
answer: “Reconciled” means that God changed us from being enemies with Him to being children of God. He did this by having Jesus die for our sins so we could be forgiven for them by grace through faith. The Bible tells us, “For since our friendship with God was restored by the death of his Son while we were still his enemies, we will certainly be saved through the life of his Son” (Romans 5:10 NLT).

question: What does the song mean by “creation reconciled”?
answer: This means that God reconciles His creation to Himself. Remember that Adam and Eve were created on the sixth day of Creation (Genesis 1:26), so we are part of His creation and are reconciled to Him when we believe in Jesus. God will also reconcile the rest of His creation, as the Scripture states: “For we know that all creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time” (Romans 8:22 NLT).

question: What does “redemption” mean?
answer: “Redemption” means that God delivers us from evil by having Jesus pay the price for our sins. The Bible says, “For you know that God paid a ransom to save you from the empty life you inherited from your ancestors. And it was not paid with mere gold or silver, which lose their value. It was the precious blood of Christ, the sinless, spotless Lamb of God” (1 Peter 1:18-19 NLT).

question: In the episode "Nicodemus" what were the gondola cabs ascending and descending on?
answer: The ski lifts utilized electromagnetic cables. The glowing light was a result of the electromagnetic nature of the lift, and the different colors informed the skiers of the various runs that the cable lines went to.

question: In the episode "Nicodemus" why did Superbook send Chris to a different place than Joy and Gizmo?
answer: Superbook had something different for Chris to learn.

question: In the episode "Nicodemus" what was the Scripture passage the man in the Temple court read from the scroll?
answer: He read Isaiah 53:6-8.

question: What was the golden glow on the blind man and the lame man when Jesus laid His hands on them?
answer: We used artistic license to depict the healing power of God.

question: In the episode "Nicodemus" what was the passage that Nicodemus read from Ezekiel?
answer: He read from Ezekiel 36:25-27.

question: What was the verse spoken by the narrator at the end of the episode "Nicodemus"?
answer: It was Romans 10:9-10 from the Contemporary English Version: “So you will be saved, if you honestly say, 'Jesus is Lord,' and if you believe with all your heart that God raised him from death. God will accept you and save you, if you truly believe this and tell it to others.”

question: What was the Bible verse that Gizmo shared about water baptism?
answer: He read from 1 Peter 3:21: “But baptism is more than just washing your body. It means turning to God with a clear conscience, because Jesus Christ was raised from death” (CEV).

question: When Jesus was walking through Jericho and Zacchaeus was in the tree, why did you show Jesus pausing before turning and speaking to Zacchaeus?
answer: We used creative license to show Jesus being led by the Holy Spirit as to what the heavenly Father wanted Him to do.

question: During the meal at Zacchaeus' house, how do you know that Jesus whispered something to Zacchaeus?
answer: We utilized creative license to depict Jesus speaking a personal message that touched Zacchaeus' heart.

question: What was the salvation prayer that Joy prayed in the episode "Zacchaeus"?
answer: She prayed: “Dear God, I admit that I'm a sinner, and that I want to have a relationship with You. Please forgive me for all of the wrong things I have done. I believe in my heart that Jesus died and rose again to take away my sin and I declare Jesus Christ as my Lord and Savior. Please fill me with your Holy Spirit that I may be faithful to You. Thank You for saving me and for letting me become Your child. Please speak to me and help me to hear Your voice and to follow Your ways. I look forward to spending time with You both here on earth and in heaven. In Jesus' name I pray, Amen.”

question: Why didn't you show Jesus moving out of the road when the centurion's chariot quickly approached?
answer: We used creative license to show that Jesus knew the centurion was coming to speak with Him and would stop in time. Therefore, He could wait calmly in the road.

question: Why was it considered wrong for a Jewish person to enter a Gentile's home?
answer: A law of the Rabbis stated that a Jewish person would become ceremonially defiled if he entered a Gentile's home.

question: Why was Jesus willing to break the custom of not entering a non-Jewish person's home?
answer: Jesus would have done whatever the Holy Spirit revealed to Him was the Father's will. Jesus once explained, “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing by himself. He does only what he sees the Father doing. Whatever the Father does, the Son also does” (John 5:19 NLT). Jesus also broke Jewish tradition when it came to healing on the Sabbath (see John 7:21-24).

question: Why did Jesus say that He had not seen faith like the centurion's in all of Israel?
answer: Because the centurion understood that Jesus had authority over illness and could simply speak a word of healing from a distance—and it would send forth healing.

question: What was the verse Jesus and Joy narrated when you showed Joy in the classroom and the Quantums at the charity?
answer: Jesus spoke Matthew 7:13 and Joy spoke Matthew 7:14.

question: What was the verse the youth pastor pointed out to Chris in the Bible in the episode "Sermon on the Mount"?
answer: It was Zechariah 4:10. Chris read the first part of the verse: “Do not despise these small beginnings, for the LORD rejoices to see the work begin …” (NLT).

question: Where was Isaiah when he saw the vision?
answer: We depicted Isaiah in the courtyard of the Jerusalem temple when he saw the vision of God enthroned high above the temple.

question: Where is this event (Isaiah's vision) recorded in the Bible?
answer: Isaiah's vision is recorded in Isaiah 6:1-13.

question: In the vision, what were the three flying creatures?
answer: They were heavenly beings called Seraphim. The Bible tells us that they attended to God: “Attending him were mighty seraphim, each having six wings. With two wings they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they flew” (Isaiah 6:2 NLT).

question: In the vision, what was the golden ribbon?
answer: We used artistic license to depict God's robe descending from His throne and filling the Temple. The Bible tells us, “It was in the year King Uzziah died that I saw the Lord. He was sitting on a lofty throne, and the train of his robe filled the Temple” (Isaiah 6:1 NLT).

question: Why did God tell Isaiah to preach a message that they would not accept?
answer: God always sent prophets to warn His people of impending judgment. In this situation, God saw the hearts of the people of Judah, and He knew that they would not accept the message brought by Isaiah.

question: In the episode "Isaiah" what was the fiery ball flying through the night sky and entering the tents?
answer: It was the angel of the Lord.

question: In the episode "Isaiah" why did you make the angel of the Lord look like a golden-red fiery ball instead of making it look like an angel?
answer: We used artistic license to have his appearance reflect the severe nature of his assignment.

question: Why did you show the angel of the Lord separate into multiple fiery balls when it descended on the Assyrian camp?
answer: We used artistic license to show that the angel was going throughout the Assyrian camp.

question: Why did you show Gizmo faking a high wind with a wind machine in the episode "Baptized!"?
answer: We had Gizmo acting outrageously as a way of inserting humor into the scene; however, we had Chris tell him to turn off the wind machine and come inside.

question: Why was Chris's and Joy's baptism to be outside instead of indoors?
answer: Some people are baptized outdoors in a manner that is similar to what occurred in Bible times. For example, Jesus was baptized in the Jordan River by John the Baptist (Matthew 3:13). On the other hand, many churches have baptisms inside during a regular service. This makes it more convenient for church members and visitors to see the baptisms.

question: Why was Ellie going in the wrong direction in the Superbook time tunnel in the episode "Baptized!"?
answer: Since Ellie had been in a different location from Chris and Joy, her time tunnel came in from the side to join with the one Chris and Joy were in. Because it was her first experience in the time tunnel, she was flailing and trying to get her bearings.

question: What were Peter and the other men holding on the shore in the episode "Baptized!"?
answer: They were washing their fishing net (Luke 5:2 NLT).

question: How were so many fish getting caught in the episode "Baptized!"?
answer: God used a miracle to cause the fish to get caught (Luke 5:1-11 NLT).

question: What was the verse spoken at the end of the episode "Jesus—Friend of Sinners"?

question: Why did you show an intense scene of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego in the fire?

question: Why did King Nebuchadnezzar say that an angel had delivered Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego?

question: In the segment about Jonah, why did the sailors ask what they should do to him to stop the storm?

question: Where was Paul when he was thrown to the ground and arrested?
answer: He was in the courtyard of the Temple in Jerusalem.

question: In the hospital chapel, what made the walls look like they were blue and moving? And why were they made like that?
answer: The chapel had wall fountains with blue lighting. The gentle sound of the water in the fountains along with the soft blue color would create a soothing effect for people praying in the chapel.

question: What did Chris mean when he said that Nero was a couple of bleachers short of an amphitheater?
answer: He meant that Nero's cognitive abilities were not all there. In other words, he seemed to be insane.

question: Where is the Bible passage that Julia read about Phoebe?
answer: It is in Romans 16:1-2.

question: Why did you show dangerous scenes like the one with a lion leaping toward a couple of Christians?
answer: We wanted to briefly depict the historical fact that Christians were severely persecuted but kept their faith.

question: In the last scene of the episode "Paul Keeps the Faith" with Paul in prison, who was writing down his words?
answer: It was Luke. He was serving as a scribe for Paul so his words could be shared with other believers to encourage them and instruct them in matters of the faith.

question: Did Superbook know that QBIT was in Gizmo's chest compartment when they were taken into the Superbook vortex?
answer: Actually, Superbook is the Bible, God's written Word. And God certainly knew that QBIT was there.

question: Why did QBIT say that he had experienced zero gravity?
answer: He said that because they had traveled weightlessly through the Superbook vortex.

question: In the episode "Paul and the Unknown God - Part 1" who did the Greek statues represent?
answer: They represented the false gods of Dionysus, Nike, Eros, Hephaestus, Eros, Zeus and Cybele.

question: In the episode "Paul and the Unknown God - Part 1" what were the people doing in front of the statues?
answer: They were worshiping and presenting offerings to the false gods.

question: What was the Areopagus?
answer: It was a hill in Athens that had stone seats for the council members who met there. In the King James Version of the Bible it is translated as “Mars' hill” (Acts 17:22). The term “Areopagus” can also refer to the council itself.

question: What language was the inscription “The Unknown God” in?
answer: It was in Greek in capital letters.

question: Did Gizmo create a real-life butterfly?
answer: No, only God can do that. Gizmo used advanced particle technology to make a visual display like a holograph.

question: Why didn't Kane have a futuristic translucent phone like Chris and Joy?
answer: Kane wanted to have a more durable phone for soccer practice.

question: What was the golden glow when Jesus healed the servant's ear?
answer: We used artistic license to depict the healing power of the Holy Spirit.

question: Why did you include a sound effect when Jesus healed the ear of the high priest's slave?
answer: Since we did not directly show the servant's injury, and because Jesus' hand was covering the servant's ear, we used artistic license to help the audience realize that something supernatural was occurring.

question: What was the golden glow that came over Stephen?
answer: We used artistic license to show the presence of the Holy Spirit falling on Stephen to empower him to boldly share a message from God. The Bible tells us: “At this point everyone in the high council stared at Stephen, because his face became as bright as an angel's” (Acts 6:15 NLT).

question: When Gizmo raised Chris and Joy to the high window, why didn't their bucket seats have seatbelts?
answer: Gizmo was confident that they would be safe and that if something did occur then he would be able to catch them.

question: Why did you show Stephen being hit by stones?
answer: We wanted to be biblically and historically accurate about the stoning without being unnecessarily graphic.

question: Why did you show Jesus bloody on the cross?
answer: This was a critical moment for Chris in which He remembered Jesus forgiving those who had crucified Him. In this scene, we wanted to be biblically and historically accurate in regard to the nature of the crucifixion without being unnecessarily graphic.

question: As Gizmo suggested before the last skill test, did God intervene to make Kane miss the goal shots?
answer: No, He did not. Kane missed because he was not focusing fully on his shots due to being distracted and angry at Chris.

question: Why didn't you show the angel moving the stone in front of the tomb? The Bible tells us, “Suddenly there was a great earthquake! For an angel of the Lord came down from heaven, rolled aside the stone, and sat on it” (Matthew 28:2 NLT).
answer: We used creative license to focus on the main points of the soldier's memory, that is, that a mighty angel appeared and that afterward the body of Jesus was gone.

question: What was the punishment for Roman soldiers who fell asleep while on guard?
answer: The soldiers would have faced severe punishment, perhaps even death.

question: I thought Chris was a soccer all-star, so why weren't the kids in Belize impressed with his skills?
answer: As Chris shared later in the episode, he was nervous when he first spoke to the kids about Jesus. As a result, he wasn't juggling the ball as well as he could have.

question: In the episode "Doubting Thomas" why did Superbook take Joy to a different place than Chris and Gizmo?
answer: Superbook had different things for Joy and Chris to experience and learn.

question: How do you know that Thomas had a twin brother?
answer: This is revealed in the Bible in a number of modern translations. For example, the New Living Translation tells us, “Thomas, nicknamed the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, 'Let's go, too—and die with Jesus'” (John 11:16 NLT).

question: In the episode "Doubting Thomas" why did the two men not recognize Jesus, but later on they suddenly recognized Him?
answer: The Bible tells us that at first God kept the men from recognizing Him: “But God kept them from recognizing him” (Luke 24:16 NLT). Later, God allowed them to recognize who He was: “Suddenly, their eyes were opened, and they recognized him. And at that moment he disappeared!” (Luke 24:31 NLT).

question: In the episode "Doubting Thomas" since God kept them from recognizing Jesus, why did you show Jesus with a hood and the sun shining in the men's eyes?
answer: We used creative license to help kids understand that the two men (and Joy) did not recognize Jesus at first. Without a visual cue of some sort, children watching could be confused about why these followers of Jesus did not recognize Him. Also, we wanted kids watching the show to not know it was Jesus until the two men realized it was Him. This way, the kids would feel the same kind of surprise that the two men felt.

question: In the episode "Doubting Thomas" how did Jesus disappear when the two men recognized Him, and how did He suddenly appear to the larger group of disciples in the house?
answer: After the Resurrection, Jesus apparently had a new kind of body that enabled Him to appear and disappear at will.

question: Is Gizmo really supposed to protect Chris and Joy?
answer: Yes, he is. Professor Quantum first made Gizmo to protect Chris. Naturally, if Joy is with Chris, the professor would want Gizmo to protect her, also.

question: Since Gizmo is supposed to protect Chris, why does he get scared so easily?
answer: Gizmo's sense of fear can be a warning to Chris that he should be cautious or stop what he is doing.

question: After learning so much from Superbook about the importance of the Bible and Christian living, why did Chris get so distracted by Holo-9?
answer: It was because he found the latest versions of his favorite Holo-9 games to be so exciting and thrilling. Any of us can get distracted by things in our lives, whether we are kids or adults. Sometimes we need to temporarily set aside something fun so we can focus on more important things.

question: Why did Superbook leave Gizmo behind?
answer: Superbook knew that the old Gizmo would be in their past adventures in case Chris and Joy needed his help.

question: Since Chris was so obsessed with the Holo-9 heroes, why didn't Superbook take Chris and Joy to see a miracle-working prophet or a leader of a victorious army?
answer: Superbook wanted Chris to learn what it really means to be a hero.

question: Since there was an old Gizmo in their past adventures, why weren't there older selves of Chris and Joy like in some previous episodes?
answer: Superbook didn't want Chris and Joy to merely observe their past adventures. He wanted them to experience the adventures again so Chris could learn a new lesson.

question: Did the animals really walk to the Ark in an orderly line?
answer: We used creative license to show that God brought the animals to the Ark in pairs. The Bible tells us, “Bring a pair of every kind of animal—a male and a female—into the boat with you to keep them alive during the flood. Pairs of every kind of bird, and every kind of animal, and every kind of small animal that scurries along the ground, will come to you to be kept alive” (Genesis 6:19-20 NLT).

question: In the episode "Heroes of the Bible" what was the verse from Psalms that Chris shared during the Bible study?
answer: It was Psalm 90:17: “May the favor of the Lord our God rest on us; establish the work of our hands for us—yes, establish the work of our hands” (NIV).

question: When Chris and Gizmo saw the UFO, did they fly right through the glass ceiling?
answer: No, the glass ceiling is retractable.

question: Why did you include Scripture verses from Malachi about the tithe? Isn't that an Old Testament commandment?
answer: The verses in Malachi contain a promise for God's people: “Bring all the tithes into the storehouse so there will be enough food in my Temple. If you do,” says the LORD of Heaven's Armies, “I will open the windows of heaven for you. I will pour out a blessing so great you won't have enough room to take it in! Try it! Put me to the test!” (Malachi 3:10 NLT). This promise can be claimed by believers today, for the New Testament tells us: “For no matter how many promises God has made, they are 'Yes' in Christ. And so through him the 'Amen' is spoken by us to the glory of God” (2 Corinthians 1:20 NIV).

question: Why did you show Jesus speaking about “give, and it will be given to you”? In the Bible, Jesus did not say it in the context of money.
answer: In Luke 6:27-38, Jesus taught this principle of reciprocity broadly. He did not present it with any limitations. Therefore, we believe it is a universal principle of Christian living.

question: At the end of their Superbook adventure, how did Gizmo know they were going home and not just going to another Bible event?
answer: Gizmo knew that when Superbook was going to take them to a different biblical event, there would be swirling colors coming down to form a Time Twirl. He also knew that when they were about to go home, there would be colors coming straight down to form the Time Tunnel. Since the colors of the Time Tunnel came straight down, he knew they were going home. Earlier, when Superbook took them to the crucifixion scene, they saw the Time Twirl colors in a swirling pattern. When they were about to go home, Gizmo saw that the colors of the Time Tunnel came straight down.

question: Chris said that he was going to tithe/give all of his savings because he had not been doing his share for awhile. Are you saying that people should make up for all of the tithes they missed in the past?
answer: We wanted to show that Chris had a change of heart and felt led to give sacrificially to a worthy cause, not that he had to make up for the past. It was his personal choice.

question: In the episode "The Widow's Mite" why did Gizmo crash land?
answer: Gizmo was frightened by thinking that they had seen an alien craft, so he was not concentrating as he should have.

question: In the episode "The Widow's Mite" why would a cargo deployment space jet need a cloaking mechanism?
answer: It would make the ship invisible to air and space pirates who may want to steal its technology or its valuable cargo.

question: What was the Bible verse at the end of the episode "The Widow's Mite"?
answer: “You must each decide in your heart how much to give. And don't give reluctantly or in response to pressure. 'For God loves a person who gives cheerfully.' And God will generously provide all you need. Then you will always have everything you need and plenty left over to share with others” (2 Corinthians 9:7-8 NLT).
